meanings.definition: A rope used for dragging heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The workers used a sturdy dragrope to move the heavy crate.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to secure the dragrope tightly before pulling the load.
meanings.sent3: The dragrope decided it was tired of dragging heavy things and went on strike.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a strong dragrope, pulling her through the tough times.
meanings.sent5: The dragrope's frayed end showed it had been used to its limit.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul something using a dragrope.
meanings.sent1: They had to dragrope the fallen tree out of the way to clear the path.
meanings.sent2: He always had to dragrope the heavy cart up the hill.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it could dragrope the toy mouse across the room.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a strong dragrope, pulling her towards her goals.
meanings.sent5: The team had to dragrope the boat back to shore after the engine failed.
